# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here's a Julia solution:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\W|\_" => "_")  # \W matches any non-alphanumeric character and | is used for OR operation. \_ matches underscore in regular expression
end

clean_column("My Column")
```
This function takes a string (`col`) as input, converts it to lowercase using `lowercase` function, removes leading and trailing spaces using `strip` function, replaces any white space or hyphen with an underscore using `replace` function. The regular expression `r"\W|\_"` matches any non-alphanumeric character.

When you run the code with input "My Column", it will return "my_column".
